page.title: 05LEOMINSTER FIRE STATION
page.content: The present fire station was built in 1967 and is situated close to the River Lugg in Bridge Street. There is one full-time Fire Officer and eight part time firemen. There are two fire appliances; the most recent of which cost Â£50,000 plus equipment. Each appliance carries 1800 Litres of water, 225 metres of hose, a 10 metre ladder and a roof ladder for chimney fires. Other equipment includes a portable pump,"Nicerol" foam for petrol fires, carbon dioxide cylinders for electric fires, a power hacksaw, long handled axes and oxygen breathing apparatus. Each fireman wears a helmet made of glass_fibre, water_proof leggings and boots of tough rubber with toe caps and soles steel reinforced.
